item.title: Simple and basic Dice Game
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

gh3mazter:

How do i make this? im getting into java just tell me how i run this atleast?

[code]//Import required libraries. Java allows you to reuse code multiple times. If somebody makes something, you don’t have to make it again…
import java.util.*;
//the name of the class.
class testing20{

    //every java source has a main, it serves as an entry point for the application to start. 
    public static void main (String[] args){

            The random named 'dice' is used by creating a new Random() constructor.
            Random dice = new Random();

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/datatypes.html
int number;

            //for loop. for int counter is equal to 1. counter is less than 10... increment counter.
            for(int counter=1; counter<=10;counter++){
            //generate the number using the random 'dice'
                    number = 1+dice.nextInt(6);
           //print out the number.
                    System.out.println(number + " ");
            }
    }

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Simple and basic Dice Game
item.dc:creator: @xxifish_i_x xxifish i x
item.description:
@xxifish_i_x wrote:

nice and compact and just run the program, I’m going back to the basics so I thought i’d at least share with you guys

[code]import java.util.*;

class testing20{
public static void main (String[] args){
Random dice = new Random();
int number;

	for(int counter=1; counter<=10;counter++){
		number = 1+dice.nextInt(6);
		System.out.println(number + " ");
	}
}

}[/code]
